text: The bane of Irish Reds is weak flavor, but this brags an excellent grain bill. Medium-to-dark crystal, some chocolate and very faint roast. Hops are only there to prevent too much sweetness. Yeast is neutral.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is a clear red amber with a large off-white colored head. The aroma is mild hops. Has a great mild ale flavor that is very enjoyable. the cap is solid black.

$2.49 bottle from Total Wine, West Richmond. Clear brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramels, browning leaves, cherry. Flavor is caramel malts, wet sponge, roasted nuts, tiny hint of fruit. Boring.
Pours clear copper, medium tan head. Aroma is strong caramel malt. Hints of raisin. Taste is bright caramel raisiny, some hops peeping through. Light to medium smoothly carbonated mouthfeel.

appearance: reddish brown, lingering creamy white head.  aroma: malty caramel, toasted nuts, brown sugar, some earthy hop notes.  taste: 	as the aroma indicates.  finish: 	lasting toasty, nutty/caramel sweetness, that earthy, slightly grassy note cleaning things up. notes: 	Really enjoyed this one. Always on the lookout for a good Irish Red or malt-focused American Amber, which is my top sleeper style. And this was darn good. Draught at Barrel and Bushel beerfest, 2016.

Bottle from Whole Foods Arlington. Dark ruby red / brown with medium head. Nose is plummy, fruits, molasses and malts. Taste is of malts, wheat, some caramel. Yeasty taste to it. Smooth texture. Pretty good.
Marshmallow, tea, caramel aroma. Reddish chestnut, thin yellow head. Tea and walnut, dried leaves, mildew. Light body, moderate carbonation.

12oz bottle at Pizzeria Paradiso - Old Town. Poured a dark ruby color, almost brown, but translucent enough. Aroma is lots of sweet malts, some nutty notes. Lots of caramel notes. Smooth, easy to drink. No unpleasant bitterness to be found. Actually a decent Irish Red.
Caramel aromas, earthy hops. Clear ruby with a fairly lasting white head. Dry, kind of savory. Medium bodied.
Draft at the source. Clear deep amber briwn, tan head with solid lacing. Aroma of caramel. Taste is toasted caramel and subtle pepper. OK.

Location: Draft at Capital Ale - Innsbrook, 1/17/15


Aroma: The nose is fairly light, with some toast/bread, caramel, and a bit of earth

Appearance: Pours a rusty copper color with small off-white head and minimal lacing

Flavor: Tastes similar, with a light-medium sweet, caramel and toast, and a mild bitterness

Palate: The body is light-medium, it has decent mouthfeel, and a soft, lightly dry finish

Overall Impression: 
I found this to be a fairly average beer overall. You could certainly do a lot worse, it isnt flawed or anything, its just fine.
10/5/2013. Sampled at VA Hop Fest. dark amber color. Malty aromas with dark fruit and light spice. Fruity and malty flavors, bitter towards the end. An OK beer.
Poured as a 2 oz sampler at Virginia Beer Live 2013. May have been suffering from palate blowout. Better than the kolsch. Strong coffee/toffee flavors.

Picked up a growler of this for Slutfest - but after the brown and Granite, no one was really excited to try it, and thus it went home with me.  Opened on Sunday.  Medium, clear red.  Aroma is bread, with some earthy hops.  Flavor is a match.  Quite reminiscent of Killians before it went to heck.  I well executed Irish red.  Didnt enjoy it as much as the Kolsch, but solid, and restored my faith in this new brewery after a couple of disappointments.  Wish I had brought this and the Kolsch instead of the brown and the granite!

Growler from the brewery. Pours a slightly hazy reddish-brown with a medium sized frothy head. Decent head retention. Aroma of toffee, apple and herbal hops. The taste is toasted malts, toffee, nutty notes, banana and and herbal finish. Medium bodied.

Growler shared by Drake: pours a clear deep copper amber with a spotty-lacing off-white head.  Has a lightly toasted nutty malty nose with some mild grassy hops. Starts with average fullness and light malty sweetness with some toasty caramel malty sweetness and dry nutty character before a drier smooth bittersweet finish. Pretty drinkable, but nothing out of the ordinary.

Growler. Pours a deep ruby. Clear. Weak off white bubbles. Nose is sticky red fruits, toffee, malty. Mild spicy chocolate. Taste is sticky, dark cherry dessert, super malty. Palate is minerally and aerated. Okay. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Growlers, thanks drake.  Small beige head atop copper body.  Aroma is medium sweet, caramel, faint cherry.  Taste is medium sweet, caramel, faint spice.  Light-medium body, light stickiness.
